intro: Lippia savoryi, commonly known as Mexican bush bean, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. Lippia savoryi is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract beneficial insects.
